Topic.Title: Denny's to add line item

Message.Msg: Phil, you fail to grasp the importance of this seemingly insignificant gesture. When people see the tax as a line item on a restaurant tab as opposed to the cost being buried in menu items it get's their attention. Similarly, if the population had to pay quarterly taxes as opposed to paying taxes via payroll deductions, you'd see a wholesale tax revolt. That is why the IRS hates 1099 employees.

Message.Title: New remarks on Obamacare from Alan Simpson & Erskin Bowles
Message.Msg: Who the hell is kidding who on what this is going to cost?" Simpson, the former Wyoming senator, said of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, aka "Obamacare." "We haven't found any constituency yet who wants to cut anything back anywhere." A persistent lack of support from Washington to get a handle on the debt and deficit problem took focus of much of the pair's remarks. For Simpson, the problem is especially apparent in health care, which they identified as one of five key areas where debt-reduction has to focus. Congress in 2010 passed President Barack Obama's national health care plan that will go into effect fully in 2014. "This baby is on automatic pilot," he said. "It can't possibly succeed. There is no cost containment in this baby until down the road, and we know what will happen down the road - nothing." http://finance.yahoo.com/news/obamacare-others-slashing-simpson-bowles-145835342.html

Topic.Title: gone is the twinkie

Message.Msg: and Ding Dongs. Hostess brands will be no more. Who will be next? There may be a silver lining in this. Eliminating the high cost of union labor will correct wage discrepency and benefits. I know guys who work on the Golden Gate Bridge. Unions there include painters, ironworkers, electricians, mechanics, bus drivers. The painters broke with their union a year or so ago. They realized they weren't being represented in their interests and had better results with GGB management. Who will be next? Much of the outsourcing jobs are due to greedy unions. The leftwing ding dongs will deny it but the wage scale bartered by union contracts sent many companies overseas. Ask Diane Feinstein. She and her husband were some of the first to jump when NAFTA was signed. Did you know Procter & Gamble are headquartered in Canada? Maybe cutting unions down, this won't keep happening.
